intro: Daniellia punchii, commonly known as the African saffron tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
